meanings.definition: A long, narrow ditch typically used for drainage or irrigation.
meanings.sent1: The farmer dug a trench to help water reach his crops.
meanings.sent2: The workers were busy digging a trench to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent3: Why did the squirrel jump over the trench? To reach the other side!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a trench, cutting through all obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The trench in the field was like a ribbon of earth winding through the grass.

meanings.definition: A deep furrow or ditch used for defense in warfare.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers took cover in the trench during the battle.
meanings.sent2: The trench provided protection from enemy fire.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken cross the trench? To avoid the army of ants!
meanings.sent4: The trench was a moat guarding the castle of the brave knights.
meanings.sent5: The trench was a silent guardian, shielding the soldiers from harm.

meanings.definition: To dig or cut a trench.
meanings.sent1: They decided to trench the garden for better drainage.
meanings.sent2: He used a shovel to trench the soil for the new tree.
meanings.sent3: Why did the dog trench the backyard? To bury its bone treasure!
meanings.sent4: She had to trench through the hard ground to lay the pipes.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to trench carefully to avoid damaging any cables underground.
